medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with painful toes while under investigation for dyspnea. Numbness and paresthesiae of both feet developed six months later, spreading to mid-calf level. Three months later, the patient experienced unsteadiness, tingling in fingers, clumsy hands, and right-sided sciatica. Symptoms progressively worsened.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Partial gastrectomy 20 years prior for peptic ulcer disease; anemic with vitamin B12 and iron deficiency.
